oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Residence of the late Rev. Samuel McAdow, of Dickson County, Tennessee in which the Cumberland Presbyterian Church was organized, A.D 1810
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A log cabin residence with small surrounding log buildings is pictured. The area is rural and fenced in. People are scattered about and a man on a horse is pictured. The postcard is a photograph of a sketch or a print. Sepia tone.
Sketched by J.M. Larkin, M.D. of Clarksville, Tennessee for Rev. S.P. Chestnut of Nashville, Tennessee. Name of Rev. Samuel McAdow is often listed as Rev. Samuel McAdoo.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Miintzer, F.A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Log cabins; Dwellings; Country life
